dt: {bc}concern for fact or {a_link|reality} and rejection of the impractical and visionary
{bc}a doctrine that universals exist outside the mind
{bc}the conception that an abstract term names an independent and unitary reality
{bc}a theory that objects of sense perception or cognition exist independently of the mind {dx}compare {dxt|nominalism||}{/dx}
{bc}the theory or practice of fidelity in art and literature to nature or to real life and to accurate representation without idealization

shortdef: concern for fact or reality and rejection of the impractical and visionary
a doctrine that universals exist outside the mind; specifically : the conception that an abstract term names an independent and unitary reality
a theory that objects of sense perception or cognition exist independently of the mind

dt: {bc}opposition to or deliberate eschewal of {d_link|realism|realism} especially in art and literature

dt.t: There are as many different varieties of {wi}antirealism{/wi} as there are of realism—perhaps more.

utxt.t: Nineteenth-century {wi}antirealists{/wi} invented various kinds of fantasy in order to free imagination from rational skepticism and diminish the reality principle's hold on narrative.

shortdef: opposition to or deliberate eschewal of realism especially in art and literature

dt: {bc}painting in a meticulously realistic style of imaginary or fantastic scenes or images
{bc}a literary genre or style associated especially with Latin America that incorporates fantastic or mythical elements into otherwise realistic fiction

shortdef: painting in a meticulously realistic style of imaginary or fantastic scenes or images
a literary genre or style associated especially with Latin America that incorporates fantastic or mythical elements into otherwise realistic fiction —called also magical realism

dt: {bc}a Marxist aesthetic theory calling for the didactic use of literature, art, and music to develop social consciousness in an evolving socialist state

shortdef: a Marxist aesthetic theory calling for the didactic use of literature, art, and music to develop social consciousness in an evolving socialist state

dt: {bc}the quality in art (such as animation or painting) of depicting or seeming to depict real people, objects, etc. with the exactness of a photograph

dt.t: {it}Luca{/it} is largely a departure from the sort of animation style we're used to seeing in Pixar movies, swapping {wi}photorealism{/wi} for something more stylised …
{wi}Photorealism{/wi} in gaming means the characters and scenery are supposed to mirror real life in visuals as closely as possible.
[Robyn] Penn works from found images … and in the process of painting brings a ghostly, ephemeral quality to the {wi}photorealism{/wi} of the documented ice-scapes.

dt: {bc}a movement in painting characterized by {d_link|photographic|photographic} exactness of detail

dt.t: A couple of years later his friend and fellow tennis pro Vitas Gerulaitis introduced him to {wi}photorealism{/wi}. Now that's really art, McEnroe thought. It looks just like photographs.

utxt.t: A natural offshoot of Pop Art and heir to one-man movements like Edward Hopper, {wi}photorealist{/wi} paintings depicted the postwar American landscape, highlighting Vietnam War pessimism and the plight of working-class people in the recession-era '70s.
[Don] Coen's goal, like that of the early {wi}photorealists{/wi}, is to paint the images just as they would appear as projected slides.
… using machine learning to make rendered footage look {wi}photorealistic{/wi}.

shortdef: the quality in art (such as animation or painting) of depicting or seeming to depict real people, objects, etc. with the exactness of a photograph
a movement in painting characterized by photographic exactness of detail
